content:
I am an enthusiastic learner and researcher in theoretical computer science, especially in cryptography and quantum information. My current job is a research assistant at Academia Sinica, hosted by Kai-Min Chung.
Previously, I was a blockchain researcher at DEXON foundation. I got my master’s degree in electrical engineering from National Taiwan University, where I was advised by Kai-Min Chung and Chen-Mou Cheng. I got my bachelor’s degree from National Taiwan University, where I majored in physics and minored in philosophy.
CV You can find my curriculum vitae here.
Contact Email: b01202058 at ntu dot edu dot tw
summary: I am an enthusiastic learner and researcher in theoretical computer science, especially in cryptography and quantum information. My current job is a research assistant at Academia Sinica, hosted by Kai-Min Chung. Previously, I was a blockchain researcher at DEXON foundation. I got my master’s degree in electrical engineering from National Taiwan University, where I was advised by Kai-Min Chung and Chen-Mou Cheng. I got my bachelor’s degree from National Taiwan
title: Hao Chung (Chinese:鍾豪)

content:
Writing usually helps me think deeper. These notes are designed for quick references, but not for a tutorial read from cover to cover. The materials mainly focus on definitions, theorems, proofs and some conceptual interpretations.
 Sample Space and Probability Random Variables and Distributions Vector Space No-Cloning Theorem reference of QKD literatures

content:
Below are some useful resources and links that help my academic carear!
General  Mathematical Writing by Donald E. Knuth Guide to Writing Mathematics lecture note at The University of Hong Kong  Computer Science  Introduction to Theoretical Computer Science by Boaz Barak  Quantum Computing  Quantum Computation and Quantum Information by Michael A. Nielsen and Isaac L. Chuang Quantum Information Theory by Mark Wilde John Watrous’s Lecture Notes Quantum Computation Lecture Notes by John Preskill and Alexei Kitaev Quantum Cryptography at edX by Thomas Vidick and Stephanie Wehner  Cryptography  Introduction to Modern Cryptography by Jonathan Katz and Yehuda Lindell An Introduction to Mathematical Cryptography by Jeffrey Hoffstein, Jill Pipher and Joseph H. Silverman The Foundations of Cryptography by Oded Goldreich  Multiparty Computation Here are some video courses on multiparty computation (MPC): 1. 2. 3.
